title: Artist Dashboard WebMCP Tools
description: Tool definitions for AI agents via navigator.modelContext

tools.name: get_releases
tools.description: Get all music releases from the artist dashboard. Returns title, type (single/ep/album/drop/bundle), status (draft/scheduled/live/archived), release date, total sales, and revenue data by channel.

tools.name: get_release_by_id
tools.description: Get a specific music release by its ID. Returns full details including sales breakdown by channel (direct_to_fan, digital, physical, bundles).

id.description: Release ID (e.g., rel_001, rel_002, rel_003, rel_004, rel_005, rel_006)

tools.name: get_sales
tools.description: Get sales analytics for a time range. Returns total revenue, total units sold, gross/net revenue, daily breakdown, and revenue by channel (direct_to_fan, digital, physical, bundles). Revenue values are in cents.

tools.name: get_engagement
tools.description: Get fan engagement metrics. Returns total fans, active fans, total buyers, fan growth (absolute + percentage + trend), engagement rate, purchase rate, and 90 days of fan count history.

tools.name: get_top_fans
tools.description: Get top fans ranked by total spending. Returns display name, total amount spent (in cents), purchase count, and avatar URL.

limit.description: Number of fans to return (default 5, max 20)

tools.name: get_revenue_summary
tools.description: Get a formatted revenue summary comparing different time periods. Returns revenue, change percentage, and trend for 7-day, 30-day, and 90-day windows.

tools.name: get_player_state
tools.description: Get current state of the audio player. Returns current track, playback status, volume, position, duration, playlist info, repeat mode, and shuffle state.

tools.name: play_track
tools.description: Play a music track from the dashboard audio player. Requires user confirmation before starting playback.

tools.name: control_player
tools.description: Control the audio player. Available actions: play, pause, next, previous, stop, toggle_shuffle. Optionally set volume (0-1).

volume.description: Volume level 0-1 (optional, only applied if provided)
